basics.name: Zhuoran Wang
basics.label: ECE Student@UofT | Former intern at Huawei and Amazon
basics.summary: Dedicated Computer Engineering student at the University of Toronto with a passion for AI, computer vision, and federated learning. Recognized for academic excellence and impactful research in machine learning.

work.name: Amazon
work.summary: Worked as part of the Amazon Kids Organization.
highlights: Built AWS based content moderation services with AWS provided AI tools, like Comprehend, Guardrail, and Bedrock models.
Used Java and Typescript to build backend and infrastructure.

work.name: Huawei Canada
work.summary: Conducted research in computer vision and diffusion-related topics, focusing on efficient fine-tuning methods and feature testing.
highlights: Followed and presented up to date research papers for weekly group meetings.
Designed and implemented modular adapters on UNet and Transformer-based Diffusion models for fine tuning with limited data and computation power.
Authored and submitted a research paper.
Contributed to testing and debugging of new features in the Huawei Pura 70 phone.

work.name: Far Data Lab, University of Toronto
work.summary: Explored the effects of federated learning on multimodal tasks, including language, image, video, and audio.
highlights: Collaborated with Professor Qizhen Zhang on state-of-the-art federated learning research.
Built data preparation pipelines for federated learning tasks.
Authored a research paper submitted to the ACM Web Conference.

projects.name: Web Director
projects.summary: Redesigned and modernized the club website using HTML5.
highlights: Improved site structure and styling for UTRA.

projects.name: Deep Learning Course Project
projects.summary: Analyzed accelerometer data for sleep monitoring studies.
highlights: Applied RCNN models for object detection.

projects.name: GIS Developer Course Project
projects.summary: Developed a GIS application with advanced route-finding capabilities.
highlights: Implemented the A* algorithm in C++.
